list.name: Default Changelist
list.comment: Add down method to the migration (not that it's needed by anyhow..)

task.summary: Default task
Added migrations with the fillable columns for Proposals and Votes. To include timestamps. Wll turn into soft deletes.
Fix issue with FKs - need be all same type, big fat unsigned int
Added kosher seeds
Identify the static view to render

twitter OAuth 1 working
Needs tweaking: reduce the amount of data request Request: email address
Added table to handle Auth data. Ready for facebook and google.
Argh, Git! Add/commit/push AuthData.
Add meta data in models.
Test twitter (routes) Add google auth auth_data: allow nulls in meta, nickname and avatar
Privacy Policy added to Facebook's satisfaction.
Added fontawsome sources. Added fa symbols to "social" buttons (e.g. twitter) Refactored AuthData (renamed theirId to their_id for consitency) Minor other stuff
Group the resources in the sidebar (push Auth data down a the bottom)
Changed references of Change.org to SixActs.org
Refactored forgotten reference to old "theirId."
Added final static texts from Eva's email Styling headings Work on avatar
First iteration of SyncUser. Parts of the method will be migrated to where they belong to, the User class. The Queue system for emails introduced yesterday needs fully implementing.
Social login and a primitive account sync in place. It seems that a redirect is eddential for Laravel's guard to work.

Cleared the sync method in LoginController. Simply create a user. Added Event creator,listener and observer and hooked them to User created to fire emails to the newly created user The event fore created rather than saving which should guarantee that emails are only dispatched when a user has been created. The tricky bit is the testing now woth Factory and mock deliveries.

• Set up events in general. • Implemented a one off event on user creation to handle the firing of welcome email. • The implementation makes use of the entire bus architecture inryoduced by Taylor - thus, Ovservers, Events and Listeners were introduced in the standard way recommended by the docs. The event bus is currently using DB tables - this will change to REDIS as soon as the need for debugging goes back to normal. • Added email builder and email templates. Decoupled the email from the data associated with it (user/mailshot)
Add some DocBlocks to keep sniffer happy.
Show proposals in home view (the beginning.)
Added "registration thank you" blade.

Added sixactss application wide CSS - taken from Bulma based forum by Anton Alexeev (orangeShadow)
https://github.com/BulmaTemplates/bulma-templates
Don't redirect to /home bit to / upon login or if verified logged in.

Bypassed the local/remote avatar issue with a quirk of the Image field - create a custom thumbnail which returns the image's URL if that's not null ('locally', i.e. it exists in the system's store which in this case is storage/public/avatars) or swap it on the view level with a Gravatar URL made up on the fly. Similarly I will tackle the end-user facing component (forum view.) Anything more complicated than that calls for a custom field.A custom field has indeed been added (id Metafield) - it seems that Otwell recommends a separate Git repo for each of these and perhaps the idea is that they become portable. It is not worth making a custom field for avatars but it will most definitely come in handy in the future.
Fixed mangled author's name Added makeGravatar method (avatar->social avatar->gravatar)
Monday "morning" commit. Reflecting on the automated EMail Verification dilemma.
Verified use migrations added
Ixed type - synUser->syncUser
Fixed the text in the email templates. Added conditional for password so that email can be used for both synced and "native" registrations (needs testing.)
User registration, syncing and appropriate emails more or less working. Some of this work needs migrating to forgot/rest password.
Added screenshot of app to repo.
Made screenshot smaller
Made screenshot smaller
Made screenshot smaller
Swapped Laravel-Bulma preset for npm vanilla install which immediately sorted out all the form issues. I will also enable me to customise the colour scheme as requested by client.
Changed HomeController to SiteController to bypass code sniffer's complains. It's better this way anyway, as it leaves the AppController for the app.
phpcs stuff..
Satisfying phpcs
Fixed a gazillion code style related "issues"
More phpcs fixes and re-arrangements. Ready to move onto the beef (react, voting)
Change auth() to auth('api') for ->attempt and ->factory() as per https://github.com/tymondesigns/jwt-auth/issues/1484 to get the JWT token working..
re-enabled API routes after getting main logins working again (nothing to do with API routes, see previous three commits..)
Added API tests for registration/login etc.
Do not allow API access to unverified users. Closed issue #1
Add support for up and down voting. Create VIEW vote aggregations.
Add down method to the migration (not that it's needed by anyhow..)

MESSAGE.value: Added "registration thank you" blade.

Added sixactss application wide CSS - taken from Bulma based forum by Anton Alexeev (orangeShadow)
https://github.com/BulmaTemplates/bulma-templates
Don't redirect to /home bit to / upon login or if verified logged in.

Bypassed the local/remote avatar issue with a quirk of the Image field - create a custom thumbnail which returns the image's URL if that's not null ('locally', i.e. it exists in the system's store which in this case is storage/public/avatars) or swap it on the view level with a Gravatar URL made up on the fly. Similarly I will tackle the end-user facing component (forum view.) Anything more complicated than that calls for a custom field.A custom field has indeed been added (id Metafield) - it seems that Otwell recommends a separate Git repo for each of these and perhaps the idea is that they become portable. It is not worth making a custom field for avatars but it will most definitely come in handy in the future.
Fixed mangled author's name Added makeGravatar method (avatar->social avatar->gravatar)
Monday "morning" commit. Reflecting on the automated EMail Verification dilemma.
Verified use migrations added
Ixed type - synUser->syncUser
Fixed the text in the email templates. Added conditional for password so that email can be used for both synced and "native" registrations (needs testing.)
User registration, syncing and appropriate emails more or less working. Some of this work needs migrating to forgot/rest password.
Added screenshot of app to repo.
Made screenshot smaller
Swapped Laravel-Bulma preset for npm vanilla install which immediately sorted out all the form issues. I will also enable me to customise the colour scheme as requested by client.
Changed HomeController to SiteController to bypass code sniffer's complains. It's better this way anyway, as it leaves the AppController for the app.
phpcs stuff..
Satisfying phpcs
Fixed a gazillion code style related "issues"
More phpcs fixes and re-arrangements. Ready to move onto the beef (react, voting)
Change auth() to auth('api') for ->attempt and ->factory() as per https://github.com/tymondesigns/jwt-auth/issues/1484 to get the JWT token working..
re-enabled API routes after getting main logins working again (nothing to do with API routes, see previous three commits..)
Added API tests for registration/login etc.
Do not allow API access to unverified users. Closed issue #1
Add support for up and down voting. Create VIEW vote aggregations.
Add down method to the migration (not that it's needed by anyhow..)

option.name: LAST_COMMIT_MESSAGE
option.value: Add down method to the migration (not that it's needed by anyhow..)
